titleInfo.title: Photograph of Annie Sybil Thomas Jarrett and William Robert Jarrett, 1940s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Black and white photograph of Annie Sybil Thomas Jarrett with her husband William Robert Jarrett. The photograph was taken in the front of their home in Paris, Tennessee. They each wear dark colored suits and white shirts. Annie Sybill Thomas Jarrett (1881 - 1975) was a teacher and lifelong member of the Republican Party. She was born near Saulsbury, Tennessee. She is the daughter of Harriet and John Thomas Sr. She attended Clay Street School in Memphis, Tennessee, which was at the site of the current Booker T. Washington High School. She graduated with a degree in education from Lane College. She advocated in her community and schools for the teaching of African American history. According to family tradition, she urged family members to vote Republican to honor Abraham Lincoln and the Emancipation Proclamation.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
